meanings.definition: To exaggerate or overemphasize emotions or events for dramatic effect.
meanings.sent1: She was melodramatising her disappointment over not getting the toy she wanted.
meanings.sent2: The actor was melodramatising his lines to make the audience feel more emotion.
meanings.sent3: The children were melodramatising their pretend play by pretending to be superheroes saving the world.
meanings.sent4: Her tears were melodramatising the heartbreak she felt over losing her favorite book.
meanings.sent5: The storm outside was melodramatising the eerie atmosphere of the old haunted house.

meanings.definition: The act of portraying a situation in an overly dramatic or sensationalized manner.
meanings.sent1: His melodramatising of the story made it more entertaining for the listeners.
meanings.sent2: The melodramatising in the movie made it feel like a soap opera.
meanings.sent3: The melodramatising of the cake being eaten by the dog was quite a sight to see.
meanings.sent4: The news anchor's melodramatising of the weather made it seem like a major disaster was imminent.
meanings.sent5: The melodramatising of the play's climax left the audience on the edge of their seats.
